thread.title: The Boy and the Bindi hangs out on this week’s National Post Bestseller List | National Post
thread.title_full: The Boy and the Bindi hangs out on this week’s National Post Bestseller List | National Post

author: National Post Staff
title: The Boy and the Bindi hangs out on this week’s National Post Bestseller List | National Post
text:
The National Post Bestseller List is reported weekly by a different Canadian bookstore, featuring local favourites alongside national hits. This week’s list features children’s titles courtesy of Type Books ( typebooks.ca – 883 Queen Street West, Toronto). 
Picture Books I Dissent: Ruth Bader Ginsberg Makes Her Mark by Debbie Levy, illustrated by Elizabeth Baddeley (Simon & Schuster, 40 pp; $23.99) Little Blue Chair by Carey Fagan, illustrated by Madeline Kloepper (Tundra, 40 pp; $22.99) Little People Big Dreams: Maya Angelou by Lisbeth Kaiser, illustrated by Leire Salaberria (Frances Lincoln, 32 pp; $17.99) Du Iz Tak? by Carson Ellis (Candlewick, 48 pp; $21.99) A is for Activist by Innosanto Nagara (Triangle Square, 32 pp; $23.95) The Liszts by Kyo Maclear, illustrated by Julia Sarda (Tundra, 40 pp; $21.99) We Found a Hat by Jon Klassen (Candlewick, 56 pp; $21.99) Ada Twist, Scientist by Andrea Beaty, illustrated by David Roberts (Abrams, 32 pp; $21.95) The Boy and the Bindi by Vivek Shraya, illustrated by Rajni Perera (Arsenal Pulp, 38 pp; $17.95) Clifford the Big Red Dog: vintage edition by Norman Bridwell (Cartwheel, 48 pp; $11.99) 
Chapter Books Women in Science: 50 Fearless Pioneers Who Changed the World by Rachel Ignotofsky (Ten Speed, 128 pp; $22.99) The Sun Is Also a Star by Nicola Yoon (Doubleday Canada, 384; $21.99) Narwhal: Unicorn of the Sea by Ben Clanton (Tundra, 64 pp; $10.99) The Princess in Black Takes a Vacation by Shannon Hale and Dean Hale, illustrated by LeUyen Pham (Candlewick, 96 pp; $18.99) Rad Women Worldwide: Artists and Athletes, Pirates and Punks, and Other Revolutionaries Who Shaped History by Kate Schatz, illustrated by Miriam Klein Stahl (Ten Speed, 112 pp; $18.99) A Boy Named Queen by Sara Cassidy (Groundwood, 80 pp; $14.95) Julia Vanishes by Catherine Egan (Doubleday Canada, 384 pp; $21.99) Ghost by Jason Reynolds (Atheneum/Caitlyn Dlouhy, 192 pp; $22.99) Dog Man: Unleashed by Dav Pilkey (Scholastic, 224 pp; $12.99) Raymie Nightingale by Kate DiCamillo (Candlewick, 272 pp; $20)
